title: Project Management
description: Creating and cloning Apps Script projects

cards.task: Create a new Apps Script project
cards.description: Creates a new Apps Script project in your current directory and on Google Drive. Generates .clasp.json and appsscript.json files.
cards.whenToUse: When starting a new Apps Script project from scratch.
scenarios: New standalone project: Creating a script for a custom automation tool
Container-bound script: Using --type sheets for a script bound to a Google Sheet
Add-on development: Starting a new Google Workspace add-on

cards.task: Create a new Apps Script project with a specific title and type
cards.description: Creates a project with a custom title and type. Valid types: standalone, sheets, docs, slides, forms.
cards.whenToUse: When you want a descriptive name and need to specify if it's bound to a document.
scenarios: Sheet-bound app: Creating 'Sales Dashboard' bound to Sheets for custom menus
Team collaboration: Using descriptive titles for easy identification
Form automation: Creating 'Survey Processor' with --type forms

cards.task: Create a script bound to a specific Google Sheet
cards.description: Creates a container-bound script attached to a specific Google Sheet, Form, Doc, or Slides.
cards.whenToUse: When building custom functions, menus, or automation for a specific document.
scenarios: Custom sheet functions: Creating a script bound to a sales tracking sheet
Form processor: Binding a script to a Google Form for custom logic
Document automation: Creating a script for mail merge functionality

cards.task: Clone an existing Apps Script project
cards.description: Downloads an existing Apps Script project from Google Drive to your local filesystem.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to work locally on a project created in the online editor.
scenarios: Team collaboration: Cloning a colleague's shared script to contribute
Local development: Moving an existing web-based script to your IDE
Version control: Setting up Git for an existing script

cards.task: Clone a specific historical version of a script
cards.description: Clones a specific version number instead of the latest code.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to examine or work with an older version of a script.
scenarios: Bug investigation: Cloning version 38 to see code before a bug was introduced
Audit requirements: Retrieving the exact code version deployed on a specific date
Rollback preparation: Cloning the last known good version

cards.task: List all Apps Script projects for current user
cards.description: Displays all Apps Script projects accessible by your currently authenticated account.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to find a script ID or see all your available projects.
scenarios: Script discovery: Finding the script ID of a project you want to clone
Project inventory: Viewing all your scripts to decide which ones to work on
Account audit: Checking what script projects exist in your account

cards.description: Permanently removes an Apps Script project from Google Drive. Cannot be undone.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to completely remove a script project that's no longer needed.
scenarios: Project cleanup: Removing test or prototype projects
Resource management: Deleting duplicate or obsolete projects
Security: Removing scripts containing sensitive code
